meanings.definition: Give (something) a rough or raised texture.
meanings.sent1: She texturised the clay by pressing a pattern into it.
meanings.sent2: The artist texturised the canvas with thick brush strokes.
meanings.sent3: The cat texturised the carpet by scratching it vigorously.
meanings.sent4: The wind texturised the sand dunes, creating intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The chef texturised the sauce by adding crunchy breadcrumbs.

meanings.sent1: The storyteller texturised the plot with unexpected twists.
meanings.sent2: Adding spices can texturise the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The comedian texturised his jokes with funny voices.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter texturised the dull atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The music texturised the party, making everyone dance.
